title: Translate Text
text: polyglotr package language translation tool R programming language. provides convenient functions translate text using different (free) translation services. vignette guide usage package demonstrate translate text files various languages. Currently, package functions communicate following services: Google Translate API Mymemory API Linguee API Pons API QCRI API Wikimedia Translation API

title: Translate Text
text: polyglotr stands versatile user-friendly translation tool R users. ‚Äôs consider using : Access multiple translation services without need API keys complex authentication processes. Start translating immediately installation, sign-ups account creation required. Leverage power various translation services (Google, Mymemory, Linguee, Pons, QCRI, Wikimedia) single, consistent interface. Easily switch services compare translations find best fit needs. Seamlessly integrate translation capabilities R workflows data analysis pipelines. Benefit R‚Äôs data manipulation strengths performing translations. Translate single phrases, large datasets, entire files equal ease. Create multilingual datasets effortlessly using built-functions. Benefit continuous improvements updates driven user feedback contributions. Adapt package specific needs accessing modifying source code. Get started quickly extensive documentation, vignettes, examples. Access wide range use cases best practices maximize translation efficiency. choosing polyglotr, ‚Äôre opting powerful, flexible, user-friendly translation solution integrates seamlessly R environment, without barriers authentication service-specific setups.

title: Translate English Text to Morse Code with Audio ‚Äî translate_to_morse_audio
text: list containing translated Morse code text, Morse code audio base64-encoded string, metadata.

what: Detect the language of a text ‚Äî wikimedia_detect_language
title: Detect the language of a text ‚Äî wikimedia_detect_language
text: function sends POST request Wikimedia Language ID API specified text, parses JSON response, returns detected language.

title: Detect the language of a text ‚Äî wikimedia_detect_language
Detect the language of a text ‚Äî wikimedia_detect_language
text: text text whose language detected.

title: Detect the language of a text ‚Äî wikimedia_detect_language
text: detected language.

title: Detect the language of a text ‚Äî wikimedia_detect_language
code: # Detect the language of a text wikimedia_detect_language("Hallo, wereld") #> [1] "nl"

title: Translate content using WMCloud ‚Äî wmcloud_translate
text: function sends POST request WMCloud translation API specified parameters, parses JSON response, returns translated content.

title: Translate content using WMCloud ‚Äî wmcloud_translate
code: wmcloud_translate(   content,   target_language = "en",   source_language = "en",   format = "text",   model = "nllb200-600M" )

title: Translate content using WMCloud ‚Äî wmcloud_translate
text: content content translate. Can plain text, URL (webpage), JSON string, Markdown string. target_language target language translation (default "en"). source_language source language content (default "en"). format format content ("json", "markdown", "text", "webpage"). model model use translation ("nllb200-600M" currently known work).

title: Translate content using WMCloud ‚Äî wmcloud_translate
text: translated content.

title: Translate content using WMCloud ‚Äî wmcloud_translate
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Translate plain text wmcloud_translate("rijst", target_language = "es", source_language = "nl", format = "text")  # Translate a webpage wmcloud_translate("https://en.m.wikivoyage.org/wiki/Goes", target_language = "es", source_language = "en", format = "webpage")  # Translate JSON content wmcloud_translate('{     "id": 1,     "title": "Chicken Biryani",     "description": "Chicken Biryani is a savory chicken and rice dish",     "ingredients": [ "Vegetable oil", "Garlic", "Ginger" ,"Rice"] }                ', target_language = "es", source_language = "en", format = "json")  # Translate Markdown content wmcloud_translate('# Heading  This is a [link to Wikipedia](https://wikipedia.org)                 ', target_language = "es", source_language = "en", format = "markdown") } # }
